definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Inspiration from contemporary, rhythmic and vibrant dances.
sentences.chinese: 灵感来自于现代，艺术和布满活气的跳舞。

sentences.english: This is an aqua blue again with a dynamic elf.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个水蓝色小精灵再次充斥活气。

sentences.english: Thellos is an aqua blue again with a dynamic elf.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个水蓝色小精灵再次布满活气。

sentences.english: That is just the village living in a spring-like season.
sentences.chinese: 乡村式生活气息迎春而扬。

sentences.english: Also has enhanced the vitality of the body surface of cells and suppress aging, the role of inhibition and aging.
sentences.chinese: 同时具有加强机体外表细胞的活气，克制朽迈等做用。

sentences.english: They were indignould like with hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他们由于麻烦的做事而活气。

sentences.english: These works have a strong flavour of rural life.
sentences.chinese: 这些作品具有浓郁的农村生活气息。

sentences.english: His book gives us the flavor of life on a midwestern farm.
sentences.chinese: 他的书让我们领略到在中西部农场的生活气息。

sentences.english: The content of the paper-cut contains thick life breath.
sentences.chinese: 剪纸的内容包含着浓浓的生活气息。

definition: to be reborn/to recover/to come back to life/to regenerate
close one's eyes in death and die contentedly
dead but will not close the eyes (idiom); to die with a remaining grievance
looking or feeling sickly/weak and dispirited through illness
to have only a breath of life (idiom)
to checkmate (in chess)/to be about to die
to lose all interest in life (idiom)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave
